data.title: Residents & Graduates of Otolaryngology (ENT) Residency
data.meta_description: Meet the current residents and program graduates of the Otolaryngology (ENT) Residency program at Loyola Medicine.
data.text:
PGY-5

PGY-4

PGY-3

PGY-2

PGY-1

Past Residents

Graduation

PGY-5 Residents

Veronica Drozdowski, MD

Hometown: Franklin Park, IL

Medical School: Loyola University Chicago Stritch School of Medicine

Undergraduate: University of Illinois (I-L-L!)

High School: Leyden High School

Career Interests: Pediatric Fellowship at Ann & Robert Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago

Personal Interests: Swimming, anything that involves outside, cooking with my husband, being really good at pronouncing last names

Why Loyola: It was the perfect fit in every way! From a group of residents who feel like family, to supportive attendings and nursing staff who are always watching your back, everyone at Loyola truly cares about helping you become the best you can be.

Fun Fact: I rode a camel up a mountain at 3 AM once

Nicknames: "Ronnie," "RonRon," "Ron," "Ronald Weasley," "Rondoleezza Rice"

Sullivan Smith, MD

Hometown: Duxbury, MA

Medical School: Tulane University School of Medicine

Undergraduate: Fairfield University

High School: Tabor Acadamy

Career Interests: Facial Plastics Fellowship at Quatela Center for Plastic Surgery

Personal Interests: Golf, fishing, running, snowboarding, drawing, Christmas decorations, The Office

Why Loyola: Loyola is a work-hard, surgically heavy program that I know will help me toward my goal of becoming the best surgeon and clinician that I can be. Our residents treat each other like family and our attendings are devoted to our learning. On top of that, Chicago is a fantastic place to live.

Fun Fact: I once worked as an oyster farmer.

Nickname: Sully, "Sully Sullivan," "Sull"

Brian Yuhan, MD

Hometown: Chino Hills, CA

Medical School: Oakland University William Beaumont (OUWB)

Undergraduate: Syracuse University (Go Orange!)

High School: Troy High School

Career Interests: Private Practice

Personal Interests: Music, piano, skiing, traveling, running, being outdoors, national parks, dogs, and all things Star Wars

Why Loyola: The first text I received from a co-resident after matching at Loyola ended with "welcome to the family." They truly meant it. I never knew that a group of residents/faculty could be so close, friendly, funny, and supportive as they are here.

Nicknames: "Bri," "Bri-guy," "Kent," "John Tsiang"

From the beginning...

...to now (with Sully in-house)!

PGY-4 Residents

Samantha Cerasiello, MD

Hometown: Clifton, NJ

Medical School: Rutgers New Jersey Medical School

Graduate School: Rutgers Graduate School of Biomedical Sciences

Undergraduate: Villanova University (Go Cats!)

High School: Clifton High School

Career Interests: Everything/Undecided

Personal Interests: Villanova Basketball, traveling, drawing, exercising, NY sports, skiing, podcasts, guitar, my dog Bravo, and hanging out with my family and friends

Why Loyola: I never saw a group of people so welcoming and so extremely good at their jobs. The clinical and surgical training are amazing, but it is paired with a family environment that makes this program unmatched.

Nicknames: Sam

Morgan Sandelski, MD

Hometown: Valparaiso, IN

Medical School: Indiana University School of Medicine

Undergraduate: University of Michigan (Go Blue!)

High School: LaPorte High School

Career Interests: Undecided

Personal Interests: Rock climbing, tennis, concerts, karaoke, Chicago sports, Jim Harbaugh, national parks

Why Loyola: Not only does Loyola provide an excellent surgical training with volume and support of intrests, there is such a strong sense of family amongst the whole department. I felt like I was hanging out with friends already at the interview and social.

Nicknames: "Morgana," "Slash Queen"

Kareem Shukairy, MD

Hometown: Flushing, MI

Medical School: Wayne State Univerity School of Medicine

Undergraduate: University of Michigan - Flint

High School: Flushing High School

Career Interests: Undecided

Personal Interests: Soccer, basketball, volleyball, rock climbing, snowboarding, video games, traveling, and FOOD!

Why Loyola: For me, it came down to the depth of surgical and clinical experience that Loyola offers and the welcoming environment that the faculty and residents create for everyone - including their patients. Plus, being in the greater Chicago area is awesome!

Nicknames: Kareem the Dream, K-dawg

From the start...

...to now!

PGY-3 Residents

Meghana Babu, MD

Hometown: Macomb, IL

Medical School: University of Illinois at Chicago College of Medicine

Undergraduate: University of Illinois at Chicago

High School: Macomb Senior High School

Career Interests: Undecided

Personal Interests: FOOD, concerts, tennis, Brad Pitt, arts/crafts/painting, trash reality TV, replacing my dead plants

Why Loyola: Excellent training with amazing people! Everyone has been incredibly supportive and welcoming from Day 1!

Nicknames: Papa

Jesse Siegel, MD

Hometown: Durham, CT

Medical School: University of Chicago Pritzker School of Medicine

Undergraduate: Brown University

High School: Coginchaug Regional High School

Career Interests: TBD

Personal Interests: Major and minor league baseball games, video production, visiting national parks, the chicago lakeshore

Why Loyola: An unmatched combination of quality training and quality people. It was clear that I would get excellent preparation for any career path within ENT, while also getting to work alongside an incrediby welcoming, supportive, and fun group of people.

Colten Wolf, MD

Hometown: Colorado Springs, CO

Medical School: Loyola University Chicago Stritch School of Medicine

Undergraduate: Marquette University

High School: St. Mary's High School

Career Interests: Undecided

Personal Interests: Basketball, snowboarding, hiking national parks, space/nasa, plants and the Chicago Botanical Gardens, trying new restaurants in Chicago

Why Loyola: Excellent surgical and clinical training with a great group of people to work with

Nicknames: "Colt"

Our intern year!

PGY-2 Residents

Jonathan Bergman, MD

Hometown: State College, PA

Medical School: Saint Louis University School of Medicine

Undergraduate: Penn State University

High School: State College Area High School

Career Interest: Undecided (Head & Neck?)

Personal Interests: College football (WE ARE...Penn State!), baseball, Chicago's food scene, video games, weightlifting, black coffee, dogs & cats of all shapes and sizes

Why Loyola: Loyola has amazing people that treat you like family and train you to be an extremely competent Otolaryngologist. Also, you can't beat living in Chicago!

Nicknames: JB

Luis Miguel Rubio, MD

Hometown: West Chicago IL

Medical School: Southern Illinois University

Undergraduate: Elmhurst University

High School: West Chicago High School

Career Interests: Undecided

Personal Interests: Running, basketball, soccer, playing guitar, concerts, spending time with family and friends.

Why Loyola: Great surgical and clinical training experience at a well established medical center close to home! Fun group of people to work with and be around. All graduates from this program feel well prepared for private practice or fellowship.

William Thedinger, MD

Hometown: Omaha, NE

Medical School: Tufts University School of Medicine

Undergrad: College of the Holy Cross

High School: Creighton Prep

Career Interests: TBD

Hobbies/Personal Interests: Skiing, collecting vinyl records, stand up comedy (spectating not doing), Nebraska football, and eating chicken wings

Why Loyola: As an away rotator, I loved the down to earth culture at Loyola. The relationships between residents, attendings, and other staff is extremely close-knit, beyond life at work.

Nicknames: The Dinger, Dinger, Ding

From the start...

...to now!

PGY-1 Residents

Oluwaseyi Awonusi, MD

Hometown: Indianapolis, IN

Medical School: Indiana University School of Medicine

Undergraduate: Indiana University- Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI)

High School: Ben Davis High School

Career Interests: Undecided

Personal Interests: Outdoor cycling, traveling, desserts, exploring restaurants, true crime documentaries

Why Loyola: The opportunity to have excellent surgical training in a welcoming environment! Right from my interview day, I knew everyone genuinely cared about each other.

Nickname(s): “Seyi”, “Shay”

Erika Moxley, MD

Hometown: Thousand Oaks, CA

Medical School: Tulane University School of Medicine

Undergraduate: Tulane University

High School: Thousand Oaks High School

Career Interests: Undecided

Personal Interests: Racket sports, skiing, running, hiking, golf, baking, spending time with family and friends

Why Loyola: Combination of excellent surgical/clinical training and the close-knit environment among residents and attendings.

Nickname(s):

Mayuri Yasuda, MD

Hometown: Batavia, IL

Medical School: Loyola University Chicago Stritch School of Medicine

Undergraduate: University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

High School: Illinois Mathematics and Science Academy

Career Interests: Head & Neck Oncology, Pediatrics, TBD

Personal Interests: Running marathons, painting, drawing, travelling, trying new restaurants, bothering my cat Bean, attempting to try every Chicago dog in the city

Why Loyola: Loyola has always felt like home to me and I couldn't imagine myself anywhere else. The surgical training is excellent and, more importantly, the people here are some of the most supportive and welcoming people I have ever met.

Nickname(s): May

Our intern year!
